Posts.Content: Hi all, In my last biopsy to lymph node mets I was told that I have prostate adenocarcinoma with neuroendocrine differentiation (focally positive for PSA and synaptophysin, and strong for chromogranin). Because my huge lymph node mets (9cm x 5cm) i'm in radiotherapy treatment seeking for less back pain and met shrinkage before go in Cabazitaxel treatment. My doubts: - It is usual to have such a big mets (biggest with 9cm x 5cm, but have others with 3/4 cm) and until now I have no visceral mets or bone mets? - Because my mets have neuroendocrine differentiation it worth to go on enzalutamide? - Why docetaxel was so efective (I really felt greate through the whole treatment) and abireterone didn't work absolutely? Thanks.
Posts.Signature: 2004/04 - Radical Prostectomy Gleason 8 + Radiotherapy 2004 until late 2012 - Hormonal terapy 2012/06 - CRPC 2012/12 - mCRPC - Biopsy: mets in retro-peritoneal lymph nodes, though the histology didn't clearly point to prostate adenocarcinoma mets 2013/03 - 2013/10 - Docetaxel treatment, huge shrinkage of mets 2014/01 - 2014/03 - Abireterone (didn't work at all) 2014-03 - CT scan shows multiple lymph nodes mets (biggest in the para-aortic with 9cm x 5 cm) 2014/03 - Biopsy again, result: prostate adenocarcinome with neuroendocrine differentiation 2014-04 - Radioteraphy to try to shrink the biggest met
Posts.Title: Treatment neuroendocrine differentiation
